id: Sheer luck has helped us avoid nuclear war so far -- now we need to take action
paragraph: Set edition preference:Set edition preference:Set edition preference:By Ira HelfandUpdated 12:47 PM ET, Sat November 17, 2018 Chat with us in Facebook Messenger. Find out what's happening in the world as it unfolds.Ira Helfand, a medical doctor, is a member of the international steering group of the International Campaign to Abolish Nuclear Weapons, the recipient of last year's Nobel Peace Prize. He is also co-president of the International Physicians for the Prevention of Nuclear War, the founding partner organization of ICAN and itself the recipient of the 1985 Nobel Peace Prize. The opinions expressed in this commentary are solely those of the author.  (CNN)The 100th anniversary of the World War I armistice last weekend underscored the great folly of President Donald Trump's threat to pull out of the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty with Russia. President Vladimir Putin's response that "there would be nothing left except an arms race" shows our world leaders have failed to learn from history.Sign up for our new newsletter.Join us on Twitter and Facebook
